p: Hence, although this study surveyed Antarctic sediments that experience the strong structuring forces of seasonality and iceberg impact, community structure is, like sediment communities in other regions of the world, highly correlated with organic content. The latter is generally inversely correlated with particle size [ 10], with species diversity tending to be highest at intermediate levels of sediment organic enrichment [ 59, 60]. Therefore the dominance of diatom blooms in the majority of coastal seas [ 61] and the importance of sediment structure may constrain sediment communities across latitudes. This study also adds to the evidence that the overall abundance and diversity of Antarctic soft sediment communities is high and broadly similar to that of other latitudes [ 18, 28, 62].
